posts._title: Grigoriy Aleksandrov & Sergei M. Eisenstein – Staroye i novoye aka The Old and the New aka The General Line (1929)
posts.title: Staroye i novoye
posts.excerpt: The horseless Marfa Lapkina, together with the local agronomist and other poor peasants, organizes a dairy farm in the village. However, local kulaks are actively resisting the project and any success it could provide. Old poor people also resists, not understanding the meaning of camaraderie and what their unification could bring to them…
posts.titleEnglish: The Old and the New aka The General Line

posts._title: Ulrike Ottinger – Johanna D’Arc of Mongolia (1989)
posts.title: Johanna D’Arc of Mongolia
posts.excerpt: Asian warriors take a group of Western women hostage and bring them to their all-female village, leading to a culture clash. Women Make Movies wrote: Ulrike Ottinger’s epic adventure traces a fantastic encounter between two different worlds. Seven western women travelers meet aboard the sumptuous, meticulously reconstructed Trans-Siberian Express, a rolling museum of European culture. …

posts.title: The Commitments
posts.excerpt: Quote: Foul-mouthed, fast-talking and very funny, this is Parker’s best to date. It’s an intentionally ‘small’ movie that treats a familiar subject (kids forming a rock band) with a deft intimacy. But as the young hopefuls from Dublin’s working-class Northside go through the round of auditions, rehearsals and gigs, it becomes clear that the film …

posts._title: Milos Forman – Konkurs AKA Talent Competition (1964)
posts.title: Konkurs
posts.excerpt: Quote: Two closely related episodes. Youths make problems for two local orchestras about to compete nationally, and in a talent competition a young girl gets stage fright, while another lies to her boss to compete.

posts.title: Arsenal
posts.excerpt: Set in the bleak aftermath and devastation of the World War I, a recently demobbed soldier, Timosh, returns to his hometown Kiev, after having survived a train wreck. His arrival coincides with a national celebration of Ukrainian freedom, but the festivities are not to last as a disenchanted. In Arsenal, Alexander Dovzhenko, perhaps the most …

posts._title: Bruno Dumont – Ma Loute AKA Slack Bay (2016)
posts.title: Ma Loute
posts.excerpt: Quote: Is there a more extraordinary auteur career than that of Bruno Dumont? Having started as one of Europe’s foremost purveyors of extreme cinema and extreme seriousness, he made a startling move to wacky broad comedy, and is handling it as if to the manner born. Now he gives us Ma Loute, or Slack Bay, …

posts._title: John Scheinfeld – Chasing Trane: The John Coltrane Documentary (2016)
posts.title: Chasing Trane: The John Coltrane Documentary
posts.excerpt: The film explores the global power and impact of the music of John Coltrane and reveals the passions, experiences and forces that shaped his life and revolutionary sounds. filmthreat wrote: As inspiring as the music of Coltrane itself, Chasing Trane: The John Coltrane Documentary unfolds the life of the galactic saxophonist whose soulful approach to …

posts._title: Luchino Visconti – La Caduta Degli Dei (Götterdämmerung) aka The Damned (1969)
posts.title: La Caduta Degli Dei (Götterdämmerung)
posts.excerpt: The Damned has often been regarded as the first of Visconti’s films described as “The German Trilogy”, followed by Death in Venice (1971) and Ludwig (1973). Henry Bacon (1998) specifically categorizes these films together under a chapter “Visconti & Germany”. Visconti’s earlier films had analyzed Italian society during the Risorgimento and postwar periods. Peter Bondanella’s …

posts._title: Josef von Sternberg – Der blaue Engel aka The Blue Angel (1930)
posts.title: Der blaue Engel
posts.excerpt: Article: from ~ by James Steffen Immanuel Rath is a stuffy, disciplinarian professor who is shocked to discover his students passing around a postcard of Lola-Lola, a singer at The Blue Angel cabaret. Hoping to catch his students there, Professor Rath visits the nightclub and witnesses Lola-Lola’s performance. Entranced by her dissolute charms, he gets …

posts.title: Tower
posts.excerpt: Nearly fifty years ago, a gunman rode the elevator to the twenty-seventh floor of the University of Texas Tower and opened fire. TOWER, an animated and action-packed documentary, shares the untold story of that day – when the worst in one man brought out the best in so many others.
